passage_text: The noun XENON has 1 sense: 1. a colorless odorless inert gaseous element occurring in the earth's atmosphere in trace amounts. Familiarity information: XENON used as a noun is very rare.

Greek name. In Greek, the name Xenon means-stranger. Other origins for the name Xenon include-Greek, Spanish.The name Xenon is most often used as a boy name or male name. Greek Name Meaning-stranger. Origin-Greece.

Synonyms: atomic number 54; Xe; xenon. Hypernyms (xenon is a kind of...): chemical element; element (any of the more than 100 known substances (of which 92 occur naturally) that cannot be separated into simpler substances and that singly or in combination constitute all matter).

Bi-xenon headlights typically have a shade or filter in front of the bulb during low-beam operation. When the high-beams are needed, the shade moves out of the way and the bulb’s full-light output is projected onto the road.

Full Definition of XENON. : a heavy colorless and relatively inert gaseous element that occurs in air as about one part in 20 million and is used especially in specialized electric lamps (as flashtubes) and in scientific research — see element table.

xenon is a noble or inert gas present in the atmosphere to a small extent. Xenon is present in the Martian atmosphere to the extent of about 0.08 ppm. Before 1962, it was … generally assumed that xenon and other noble gases were unable to form compounds.

On new cars, most xenon-equipped headlights are only offered as a low-beam headlight with a halogen bulb for the high beam. Bi-xenon headlights offer xenon-light output for the low and high beams, and they’re housed in the same headlight capsule/projector.
